data:
[et_pb_section fb_built="1" _builder_version="4.27.0" background_color="#0f1419" custom_padding="100px||100px||true|false" global_colors_info="{}"] [et_pb_row _builder_version="4.27.0" max_width="1200px" custom_padding="0px||64px||false|false" global_colors_info="{}"] [et_pb_column type="4_4" _builder_version="4.27.0" global_colors_info="{}"] [et_pb_text _builder_version="4.27.0" text_font="JetBrains Mono|500|||||||" text_text_color="rgba(255,255,255,0.7)" text_font_size="11px" text_letter_spacing="3px" text_orientation="center" header_2_font="Lexend|700|||||||" header_2_text_color="#ffffff" header_2_font_size="44px" header_2_line_height="1.15em" global_colors_info="{}"]

For ERP Implementers

Trapped in These Cycles?

[/et_pb_text] [et_pb_text _builder_version="4.27.0" text_font="Source Sans 3||||||||" text_text_color="rgba(255,255,255,0.7)" text_font_size="18px" text_line_height="1.6em" text_orientation="center" max_width="600px" module_alignment="center" global_colors_info="{}"]

The consulting model has structural limits. Recognizing these traps is the first step to escaping them.

[/et_pb_text] [/et_pb_column] [/et_pb_row] [et_pb_row column_structure="1_3,1_3,1_3" _builder_version="4.27.0" max_width="1200px" custom_padding="0px||0px||false|false" global_colors_info="{}"] [et_pb_column type="1_3" _builder_version="4.27.0" background_color="rgba(255,255,255,0.05)" custom_padding="40px|32px|40px|32px|true|true" border_radii="on|20px|20px|20px|20px" border_width_all="1px" border_color_all="rgba(255,255,255,0.1)" global_colors_info="{}"] [et_pb_text _builder_version="4.27.0" text_font="Lexend|800|||||||" text_text_color="#ffffff" text_font_size="64px" custom_margin="||24px||false|false" global_colors_info="{}"]

01

[/et_pb_text] [et_pb_text _builder_version="4.27.0" header_3_font="Lexend|700|||||||" header_3_text_color="#ffffff" header_3_font_size="20px" global_colors_info="{}"]

“The Man-Day Trap”

[/et_pb_text] [et_pb_text _builder_version="4.27.0" text_font="Source Sans 3||||||||" text_text_color="rgba(255,255,255,0.8)" text_font_size="16px" text_font_style="italic" text_line_height="1.7em" border_width_left="3px" border_color_left="rgba(255,255,255,0.3)" custom_padding="||0px|16px|false|false" custom_margin="||20px||false|false" global_colors_info="{}"]

“Your revenue is mathematically capped by your headcount. You cannot grow your top line without proportionally increasing your payroll costs.”

[/et_pb_text] [et_pb_text _builder_version="4.27.0" text_font="Source Sans 3||||||||" text_text_color="rgba(255,255,255,0.6)" text_font_size="15px" text_line_height="1.6em" global_colors_info="{}"]

You are selling hours, not assets. Revenue = Hours Worked, making exponential growth impossible. Every January, you start at zero again.

[/et_pb_text] [/et_pb_column] [et_pb_column type="1_3" _builder_version="4.27.0" background_color="rgba(255,255,255,0.05)" custom_padding="40px|32px|40px|32px|true|true" border_radii="on|20px|20px|20px|20px" border_width_all="1px" border_color_all="rgba(255,255,255,0.1)" global_colors_info="{}"] [et_pb_text _builder_version="4.27.0" text_font="Lexend|800|||||||" text_text_color="#ffffff" text_font_size="64px" custom_margin="||24px||false|false" global_colors_info="{}"]

02

[/et_pb_text] [et_pb_text _builder_version="4.27.0" header_3_font="Lexend|700|||||||" header_3_text_color="#ffffff" header_3_font_size="20px" global_colors_info="{}"]

“Customization Death Spiral”

[/et_pb_text] [et_pb_text _builder_version="4.27.0" text_font="Source Sans 3||||||||" text_text_color="rgba(255,255,255,0.8)" text_font_size="16px" text_font_style="italic" text_line_height="1.7em" border_width_left="3px" border_color_left="rgba(255,255,255,0.3)" custom_padding="||0px|16px|false|false" custom_margin="||20px||false|false" global_colors_info="{}"]

“You accept customization requests to win the deal, but then you become married to that code forever.”

[/et_pb_text] [et_pb_text _builder_version="4.27.0" text_font="Source Sans 3||||||||" text_text_color="rgba(255,255,255,0.6)" text_font_size="15px" text_line_height="1.6em" global_colors_info="{}"]

You can’t upgrade clients on custom code. Support becomes a nightmare of unbillable hours. Your profit evaporated the moment you said “Yes” to a non-standard request.

[/et_pb_text] [/et_pb_column] [et_pb_column type="1_3" _builder_version="4.27.0" background_color="rgba(255,255,255,0.05)" custom_padding="40px|32px|40px|32px|true|true" border_radii="on|20px|20px|20px|20px" border_width_all="1px" border_color_all="rgba(255,255,255,0.1)" global_colors_info="{}"] [et_pb_text _builder_version="4.27.0" text_font="Lexend|800|||||||" text_text_color="#ffffff" text_font_size="64px" custom_margin="||24px||false|false" global_colors_info="{}"]

03

[/et_pb_text] [et_pb_text _builder_version="4.27.0" header_3_font="Lexend|700|||||||" header_3_text_color="#ffffff" header_3_font_size="20px" global_colors_info="{}"]

“The Ghost IT Burden”

[/et_pb_text] [et_pb_text _builder_version="4.27.0" text_font="Source Sans 3||||||||" text_text_color="rgba(255,255,255,0.8)" text_font_size="16px" text_font_style="italic" text_line_height="1.7em" border_width_left="3px" border_color_left="rgba(255,255,255,0.3)" custom_padding="||0px|16px|false|false" custom_margin="||20px||false|false" global_colors_info="{}"]

“You aren’t just their ERP consultant—you are their unpaid IT department, fixing Wi-Fi, printers, and user discipline issues.”

[/et_pb_text] [et_pb_text _builder_version="4.27.0" text_font="Source Sans 3||||||||" text_text_color="rgba(255,255,255,0.6)" text_font_size="15px" text_line_height="1.6em" global_colors_info="{}"]

80% of Thai SMEs lack an internal IT Manager. You subsidize their operations with your margins. The “free work” that kills your spirit but you feel forced to do to keep the relationship.

[/et_pb_text] [/et_pb_column] [/et_pb_row] [et_pb_row _builder_version="4.27.0" max_width="1200px" custom_padding="56px||0px||false|false" global_colors_info="{}"] [et_pb_column type="4_4" _builder_version="4.27.0" global_colors_info="{}"] [et_pb_button button_url="/partner-program/" button_text="See the Way Out" button_alignment="center" _builder_version="4.27.0" custom_button="on" button_text_size="16px" button_text_color="#ffffff" button_bg_color="rgba(0,0,0,0)" button_border_width="2px" button_border_color="rgba(255,255,255,0.5)" button_border_radius="8px" button_font="Lexend|600|||||||" custom_padding="14px|32px|14px|32px|true|true" button_text_color__hover_enabled="on|hover" button_text_color__hover="#3798E4" button_border_color__hover_enabled="on|hover" button_border_color__hover="#3798E4" global_colors_info="{}"] [/et_pb_button] [/et_pb_column] [/et_pb_row] [/et_pb_section]

info.name: DigiWin Homepage - Section 4: Partner Pain Points
info.description: Track B (ERP implementers/distributors) understanding checks. Dark background section with 3 pain point cards and ghost-style CTA button.
notes: 3 cards: Man-Day Trap, Customization Death Spiral, Ghost IT Burden
Dark-on-dark design with semi-transparent card backgrounds
Ghost button (transparent bg, white border) for CTA
Mirrors Section 3 structure but inverted color scheme
